arm_group.description: Acquired Aplastic Anemia Patients Treated with Antithymocyte Globulin plus Cyclosporine

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to collect bone marrow and/or peripheral blood cells and plasma, for
      the analysis of adhesion molecules, chemokines and their receptors from newly-diagnosed
      aplastic anemia patients, and patients treated with antithymocyte globulin plus cyclosporine

clinical_study.brief_title: Collection of Blood and Bone Marrow From Patients With Aplastic Anemia for Analysis of Adhesion Molecules, Chemokines and Their Receptors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients who fulfilled entry criteria of acquired aplastic anemia age range 16-70
             years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients complicated with diabetes, tumor, pregnancy, active infection, or connective
             tissue diseases, such as systemic lupus erythematosus.

primary_outcome.description: hematologic response at 6 months following antithymocyte globulin plus cyclosporine treatment, defined as no longer meeting the criteria for severe aplastic anemia
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months following antithymocyte globulin plus cyclosporine treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
